items.prompt: If the board ________ the restructuring plan last quarter, the company wouldn't be in such a chaotic state right now.
items.explanation: This is a mixed conditional (3rd + 2nd). A past action (had approved) affecting the present state (wouldn't be).

items.prompt: We are conducting a ________ analysis to evaluate our internal strengths and external threats.
items.explanation: SWOT stands for Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats.

items.prompt: If our HR director ________ more experienced in change management, he would have anticipated the staff resistance during the merger.
items.explanation: This is a mixed conditional (2nd + 3rd). A general present state (were/was) affecting a past event (would have anticipated). 'Were' is more formal.

items.prompt: The 'L' in PESTLE analysis stands for ________ factors, such as employment laws or health and safety regulations.
items.explanation: In PESTLE, L stands for Legal factors.

items.prompt: Employees are showing signs of ________ because of the third consecutive software migration this year.
items.explanation: Change fatigue occurs when too many organizational changes happen in a short period.

items.prompt: Complete the mixed conditional: If we had implemented the CRM system two years ago, we [would have] better customer data today.
items.text: If we had implemented the CRM system two years ago, we [would have] better customer data today.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional Type A: hypothetical past action (had implemented) with a present result (would have).

items.prompt: Fill in the missing term: To ensure [strategic alignment], every department's goals must support the company's long-term vision.
items.text: To ensure [strategic alignment], every department's goals must support the company's long-term vision.
items.explanation: Strategic alignment is the synchronization of an organization's goals with its actions.

items.prompt: If the company ________ so much debt, it would have been able to acquire its competitor last month.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional (2nd + 3rd): A present state (not having debt) affecting a past possibility (would have been able).

items.prompt: A(n) ________ roadmap is essential to visualise the milestones of our five-year expansion plan.
items.explanation: An implementation roadmap maps out the steps to execute a strategy.

items.prompt: Which macro-environmental factor would 'rising interest rates' fall under in a PESTLE analysis?
items.explanation: Interest rates are an Economic factor.

items.prompt: Complete with a mixed conditional: If I [were] (be) the CEO, I would have signed that contract yesterday.
items.text: If I [were] the CEO, I would have signed that contract yesterday.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional Type B: Present state (being CEO) affecting a past action.

items.prompt: ________ involves comparing our administrative processes with the best practices of industry leaders.
items.explanation: Benchmarking is the process of comparing performance against standards or competitors.

items.prompt: If they ________ more time on stakeholder engagement, the current protests from the local community wouldn't be happening.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional Type A: Past action (had spent time) affecting a present situation (wouldn't be happening).

items.prompt: Which of these is an example of an external 'Threat' in a SWOT analysis?
items.explanation: New market entrants are an external threat.

items.prompt: Organisational ________ allows a company to pivot quickly when the market environment changes suddenly.
items.explanation: Agility is the ability to adapt and succeed in a changing environment.

items.prompt: In a SWOT analysis, 'proprietary technology' is typically classified as a(n):
items.explanation: Strengths are internal advantages such as proprietary tech or unique expertise.

items.prompt: Choose the correct mixed conditional: 'If we hadn't signed the contract last month, we ________ in this legal mess now.'
items.explanation: Mixed conditional Type A: Past action (hadn't signed) affecting present result (wouldn't be).

items.prompt: An 'outdated IT system' in a SWOT analysis is categorized as a(n):
items.explanation: Weaknesses are internal factors that limit the organization.

items.prompt: In a PESTLE analysis, 'changes in consumer lifestyle' fall under which category?
items.explanation: Social factors include demographics, culture, and lifestyle changes.

items.prompt: Rewrite using a mixed conditional: 'We didn't invest in AI. We are not leaders now.' -> If we [had invested] in AI, we [would be] leaders now.
items.text: If we [had invested] in AI, we [would be] leaders now.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional: Past action (had invested) and present state (would be).

items.prompt: Rewrite using a mixed conditional: 'The CEO is conservative. She didn't approve the merger.' -> If the CEO [weren't] so conservative, she [would have approved] the merger.
items.text: If the CEO [weren't] so conservative, she [would have approved] the merger.
items.explanation: Type B mixed conditional: Present state (weren't) and past result (would have approved).

items.prompt: Strategic ________ ensures that all departments work towards the same high-level corporate goals.
items.explanation: Alignment is the synchronization of internal processes with the overall strategy.

items.prompt: Which of these is a 'Technological' factor in a PESTLE analysis for a law firm?
items.explanation: AI and automation are technological factors.

items.prompt: In a SWOT analysis, a 'competitor going bankrupt' is best described as a(n):
items.explanation: External factors that favor the company are opportunities.

items.prompt: Correct the mixed conditional: 'If I hadn't lost my laptop, I [would be] able to finish the report now.'
items.text: If I hadn't lost my laptop, I [would be] able to finish the report now.
items.explanation: Past action (hadn't lost) affecting current ability (would be).

items.prompt: What is the primary purpose of conducting a SWOT analysis?
options: To evaluate competitive position and develop strategic planning
items.explanation: SWOT helps organizations understand their current standing and future strategic possibilities.

items.prompt: Complete with a mixed conditional: 'If we [had secured] (secure) the vendor contract in Q1, we would not be experiencing shortages today.'
items.text: If we [had secured] the vendor contract in Q1, we would not be experiencing shortages today.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional: Past action (had secured) and present result (would not be).

items.prompt: Complete the phrase: 'We need to ________ our resources with our core strategy.'
items.explanation: In business, you 'align' resources to ensure they support the strategy.

items.prompt: A 'strategic post-mortem' is a review conducted:
options: After a project is completed to evaluate outcomes
Only when a project is successful
items.explanation: Post-mortems are debriefs that allow teams to learn from past performance (successes and failures).

items.prompt: In a SWOT analysis, what is the main difference between an Opportunity and a Strength?
options: Strengths are external; Opportunities are internal
Strengths are internal; Opportunities are external
items.explanation: Strengths are internal advantages; Opportunities are external factors that can be exploited.

items.prompt: The feeling of resentment and apathy among employees caused by excessive organizational changes is called:
items.explanation: Change fatigue occurs when staff are overwhelmed by constant transitions.

items.prompt: What is the first step in Kotter's 8-Step Model of Change?
items.explanation: Kotter's model begins with creating a sense of urgency to motivate change.

items.prompt: Which framework is used to categorize stakeholders based on their influence and level of interest?
items.explanation: The Power/Interest Matrix helps prioritize stakeholder engagement.

items.prompt: If our IT infrastructure ________ more modern, we would have migrated to the cloud last year.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional Type B: Present state (were) affecting a past event (would have migrated).

items.prompt: A stakeholder with 'High Power' but 'Low Interest' should be ________ according to the Power/Interest Matrix.
items.explanation: High power / low interest groups should be kept satisfied to avoid them blocking the project.

items.prompt: In PESTLE, 'Political stability' and 'trade restrictions' fall under which category?
items.explanation: These are primary Political factors.

items.prompt: Which of these is a sign of 'Change Fatigue' in a department?
items.explanation: Change fatigue often leads to burnout, apathy, and withdrawal.

items.prompt: The 'P' in SWOT stands for:
items.explanation: SWOT stands for Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats. There is no P.

items.prompt: Complete the mixed conditional: 'If we [were] (be) more agile, we [would have adapted] (adapt) to the market crash last year.'
items.text: If we [were] more agile, we [would have adapted] to the market crash last year.
items.explanation: Type B mixed conditional: General present state (were) and past result (would have adapted).

items.prompt: In a SWOT analysis, a 'lack of specialized staff' is an internal ________.
items.explanation: Internal deficiencies are categorized as Weaknesses.

items.prompt: What does 'PESTLE' stand for?
options: Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Legal, Environmental
Planning, Execution, Strategy, Testing, Logistics, Evaluation
Price, Equity, Sales, Tax, Labor, Efficiency
Process, Environment, Sustainability, Teamwork, Leadership, Ethics
items.explanation: PESTLE is a framework for macro-environmental analysis.

items.prompt: A visual guide that breaks down a long-term strategy into achievable milestones is called an implementation ________.
items.explanation: An implementation roadmap provides a timeline for executing a strategy.

items.prompt: Change ________ are individuals within an organization who help drive and implement new initiatives.
items.explanation: Change agents (or champions) are key to overcoming resistance.

items.prompt: Correct the grammar: 'If we [had been] more focused last year, we [would be] more successful now.'
items.text: If we [had been] more focused last year, we [would be] more successful now.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional Type A: Past action (had been) affecting present result (would be).

items.prompt: In the Power/Interest Matrix, stakeholders with 'Low Power' and 'Low Interest' should be:
items.explanation: They require minimal effort but should be monitored for changes in interest or power.

items.prompt: The process of comparing your business processes and performance metrics to industry best practices is called:
items.explanation: Benchmarking identifies performance gaps and areas for improvement.

items.prompt: Who is considered a stakeholder in a company?
options: Anyone affected by or having an interest in the organization's actions
items.explanation: Stakeholders include employees, suppliers, the community, and shareholders.

items.prompt: A stakeholder with 'High Power' and 'High Interest' is considered a 'Key ________'.
items.explanation: Key players must be managed closely and engaged frequently.

items.prompt: Complete the mixed conditional: 'If the company [had been] (be) more transparent last year, investors [wouldn't be] (not be) so worried now.'
items.text: If the company [had been] more transparent last year, investors [wouldn't be] so worried now.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional: Past action (had been) and present result (wouldn't be).

items.prompt: In corporate governance, 'accountability' means:
options: Ensuring leaders are responsible for their strategic decisions
items.explanation: Accountability is the obligation to take responsibility for decisions and their outcomes.

items.prompt: Rewrite using a mixed conditional: 'We didn't involve the community. There are protests today.' -> If we [had involved] the community, there [wouldn't be] protests today.
items.text: If we [had involved] the community, there [wouldn't be] protests today.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional.

items.prompt: Which framework is most suitable for analyzing external risks like 'new government regulations'?
items.explanation: PESTLE focuses on macro-environmental external factors (Political, Legal, etc.).

items.prompt: The degree to which an organization's actions are observable by outsiders is called corporate ________.
items.explanation: Transparency involves openness about company goals and performance.

items.prompt: In a SWOT analysis, 'entering a new emerging market' is categorized as a(n):
items.explanation: New markets are external opportunities for growth.

items.prompt: Complete with 'strategic alignment': 'We must ensure [strategic alignment] between our budget and our long-term goals.'
items.text: We must ensure [strategic alignment] between our budget and our long-term goals.
items.explanation: Vocabulary check: strategic alignment.

items.prompt: Correct the mixed conditional: 'If the CEO [hadn't been] (not be) so busy yesterday, she [would be] here now.'
items.text: If the CEO [hadn't been] so busy yesterday, she [would be] here now.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional: Past action (hadn't been) and present result (would be).

items.prompt: Why is ethical behavior considered a strategic asset?
options: It eliminates the need for competition
It builds stakeholder trust and protects brand reputation
It allows companies to ignore PESTLE factors
It is required only for non-profit organizations
items.explanation: Ethics build long-term value and trust with investors and customers.

items.prompt: Mixed conditional: 'The manager is skilled. He saved the company last year.' -> If the manager [weren't] so skilled, he [wouldn't have saved] the company last year.
items.text: If the manager [weren't] so skilled, he [wouldn't have saved] the company last year.
items.explanation: Type B mixed conditional: Present state (weren't) and past result (wouldn't have saved).

items.prompt: Complete the business idiom: 'We need to ________ a consensus among key ________ before proceeding.'
items.explanation: To 'build a consensus' means to reach a general agreement.

items.prompt: What is the primary goal of the Power/Interest Matrix in strategic planning?
options: To prioritize stakeholder communication and engagement
items.explanation: It helps decide who to manage closely and who to just monitor.

items.prompt: The practice of imagining and preparing for different possible futures to reduce risk is called:
items.explanation: Scenario planning prepares an organization for various 'what if' situations.

items.prompt: Developing methods to minimize the effects of future shocks and stresses is called ________.
items.explanation: Future-proofing is about long-term resilience and adaptability.

items.prompt: In SWOT, 'new environmental regulations' that could hurt production are categorized as a(n):
items.explanation: External factors that could damage the company are Threats.

items.prompt: Mixed conditional: 'If we [had known] (know) more about AI three years ago, our company [wouldn't be] (not be) so far behind today.'
items.text: If we [had known] more about AI three years ago, our company [wouldn't be] so far behind today.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional: Past knowledge (had known) affecting present state (wouldn't be).

items.prompt: An implementation roadmap should ideally include specific ________ and time-bound actions.
items.explanation: Milestones are markers of progress in a strategy's execution.

items.prompt: Rewrite using mixed conditional: 'We didn't do scenario planning. We are confused now.' -> If we [had done] scenario planning, we [wouldn't be] confused now.
items.text: If we [had done] scenario planning, we [wouldn't be] confused now.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional.

items.prompt: In a PESTLE analysis, 'interest rates' and 'inflation' are categorized as ________ factors.
items.explanation: These are core macro-economic factors.

items.prompt: What is the result of effective benchmarking?
options: Identifying performance gaps and learning from industry leaders
Reducing the need for a SWOT analysis
items.explanation: Benchmarking helps an organization improve by comparing itself to the best.

items.prompt: A 'worst-case scenario' in planning is used to:
options: Identify risks and prepare contingency plans
items.explanation: Preparing for the worst-case scenario reduces the impact of negative events.

items.prompt: Which technological factor is currently most significant for future-proofing most businesses?
items.explanation: AI is a transformative technological factor in the modern economy.

items.prompt: Correct the mixed conditional: 'If we [had been] (be) smarter last year, we [would be] more profitable today.'
items.text: If we [had been] smarter last year, we [would be] more profitable today.
items.explanation: Type A mixed conditional.

items.prompt: In an implementation roadmap, what is a 'milestone'?
options: A heavy stone found in the office
A significant stage or event in the development of a project
The distance between two branch offices
items.explanation: Milestones help track progress towards the final goal.

items.prompt: If our company ________ more financially stable, we would have struggled to afford these upgrades.
items.explanation: Type B mixed conditional: Present state (weren't) affecting past result (would have struggled).

items.prompt: Which of these is a 'Social' factor in PESTLE analysis?
options: Changes in demographics and consumer attitudes
items.explanation: Demographics and attitudes are social factors.

items.prompt: A company that pivots quickly to avoid a crisis is demonstrating organizational ________.
items.explanation: Agility is the capacity to change direction and adapt quickly.
